intro: Duchassaingia, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features a basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Duchassaingia is drought-tolerant and thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Its fibrous root system helps it survive in harsh, dry environments.
